item.title: Your YAML could be DRYer
item.description: Github Actions are the go-to continuous integration tool for plenty of reasons - chief among them: first-party support with Github, pretty decent performance, and relatively cheap runner instances. However, one place Github Actions has fallen short relative to other YAML-based players in the space (namely CircleCI) has been the inability to DRY up the YAML config files. However, with a cool new 1 feature called Composite Run Steps, your repeated shell script invocations can now happily live in a separate YAML file!
